experiment.name: Transcription profiling by array of Arabidopsis mutant for ckh1 and ckh2 after treatment with kinetin

description.text: Analysis of calli derived from the wild type (Ler), the ckh1 and ckh2 mutants cultured on media in the absence of cytokinin (control), in the presence of low (25 ng/ml kinetin) or high (200 ng/ml kinetin) levels of cytokinin, or in the presence of Trichostatin A (TSA). In these conditions, a constant 2,4-dichlorophenoxyacetic acid (2,4-D) was included as an auxin. Hypocotyl segments of the wild type (Ler), ckh1-1 and ckh2-1 mutants were cultured for 3 days on media containing 100 ng/ml 2,4-D in the absence of kinetin or in the presence of low (25 ng/ml) or high (200 ng/ml) kinetin or 100ng/ml TSA, and then collected and rapidly frozen by liquid nitrogen. Total RNA was extracted by using an RNeasy plant kit (Qiagen; USA), and 10 Âµg of total RNA was used for target preparation by using

bibliography.authors: Kubo M, Furuta K, Demura T, Fukuda H, Liu YG, Shibata D, Kakimoto T
bibliography.title: The CKH1/EER4 gene encoding a TAF12-like protein negatively regulates cytokinin sensitivity in Arabidopsis thaliana.

bibliography.authors: Furuta K, Kubo M, Sano K, Demura T, Fukuda H, Liu YG, Shibata D, Kakimoto T
bibliography.title: The CKH2/PKL chromatin remodeling factor negatively regulates cytokinin responses in Arabidopsis calli.
